{{Outdated feature|edition=je}}
{{more images|Figure out a way to obtain versions of this from 13w18a to 13w37b}}
[[File:14w05a items-atlas.png|thumb|items-atlas in [[14w21b]], the last version to use this file.]]

'''<samp>items-atlas</samp>''' was a [[texture atlas]] used by the game to store textures for [[item]]s, following the deprecation of <samp>[[items.png]]</samp>

It was eventually merged with <samp>[[blocks-atlas]]</samp> to form <samp>[[textures-atlas]]</samp>.

== History ==
{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.5|dev=13w02a|Added <samp>items-atlas</samp>{{verify|was it internally called this at this point?}} with the deprecation of <samp>[[items.png]]</samp>.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=13w02b|<samp>items-atlas</samp>'s dimensions must always be powers of two.{{verify|judging by the file produced in the .minecraft folder. Does this also apply to the real atlas?}}}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.7.2|dev=13w41a|<samp>items-atlas</samp> and its dimensions are now announced in the game log when loading the game and when changing resource packs.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.8|dev=14w25a|<samp>items-atlas</samp> has been merged with <samp>blocks-atlas</samp> to create <samp>[[textures-atlas]]</samp>.}}
}}

=== Debug output ===
{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.5|dev=13w02a|The game now outputs copies of the atlas, under the name <samp>stitched_items.png</samp>, to the [[.minecraft]] folder.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=13w02b|The file produced in the .minecraft folder now has dimensions restricted to powers of two. Whether this also applies to the atlas itself is unknown.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=13w03a|The file produced in the .minecraft folder now has transparency; previously it was completely opaque.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=13w09a|The produced file has been renamed from <samp>stitched_items.png</samp> to <samp>debug.stitched_items.png</samp>.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.6.1|dev=13w18a|<samp>debug.stitched_items.png</samp> is no longer produced in the .minecraft folder.}}
}}
